item.title: Pokemon GO Glitch Shows Chansey Defending a Gym for Over 50 Years
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Glitch shows Chansey defending gym for 55 years.
  • Bug related to Unix time, not actual defense time.
  • Players amused by meme-worthy glitch, with no harm done.

A Pokemon GO player shared a weird glitch that indicated that their Chansey had been defending a Pokemon Gym for over 50 years. The odd moment has an explanation, but it's nonetheless amusing the community to think about defending a Gym in Pokemon GO for that long.

Pokemon GO Gyms are a key part of gameplay. If a Pokemon Gym falls under a certain team's control, players on that team can leave their Pokemon to defend it, and it will return to them when the Gym is taken over by someone else. For many players, Pokemon return home almost immediately, while other defending Pokemon can end up stuck for months, if not years. However, this Chansey has supposedly been defending a gym since long before Pokemon came to exist.

Pokemon fan Frunchise shared a screenshot from their account that showed the details on their Pokemon defending gyms. All but one of the Pokemon have normal defending times ranging from a couple hours to as long as nine days. However, their Chansey named Pillow, according to the game, has been defending its position for 20,006 days, 13 hours, 45 minutes, and 5 seconds. In other words, the Chansey has allegedly been defending a single gym for nearly 55 years - about twice as long as the Pokemon series as a whole has even existed.

Come Home Already, Chansey

Clearly, Chansey hasn't actually been defending a Pokemon Gym since 1969/1970. This particular bug likely has something to do with the default time set on many computers and programs. Unix time, which is frequently used in computing, calculates time based on how many seconds have passed since 1/1/1970. For whatever reason, as the Chansey was getting kicked out of its gym after defending for roughly nine actual days, the time display became glitched and showed how much time had passed since 1/1/1970, rather than when the Chansey was actually dropped off.

While this was just a harmless glitch, fans have been quite amused by it, joking about how long the Chansey has been defending with various memes. Others have taken the opportunity to poke at how the rewards for defending gyms in Pokemon GO work, saying that the Chansey would have spent all that time for a mere 50 PokeCoins. However, some pointed out that Pokemon GO players have no way to bring home a defending Pokemon without it being defeated, which is considered a problem by many fans. Players should act with caution when choosing to defend a Pokemon Gym, but thankfully, no one should have to expect to welcome their Pokemon back 50 years later.

item.title: 5 Open-World Games With The Best Farming Mechanics
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Games No Man's Sky and Terraria offer expansive space and mythical farming experiences.
  • Stardew Valley blends classical farming with fictional elements for rewarding gameplay.
  • Farming Simulator 23 and Minecraft provide technically impressive farm simulations with vast options.

The open-world genre of games has a diverse range of in-game mechanics that add variety to their large open-world settings. Such features include underwater mechanics, hunting, and a range of other elements, such as vehicle gameplay, that add an assortment of interesting things to do in sprawling open worlds.

One such component is farming; while not all open-world games have farming mechanics, some of the best open-world experiences lean on agriculture's peaceful, idyllic nature to add depth to gameplay. A popular feature of open-world games, farming allows players to relax and unwind in a recreation often overlooked in video games.

5 No Man's Sky

Expansive Space Farming, Endless Exploration

No Man's Sky is famed for its immense sandbox of procedurally generated planets that players can explore. It is also known for its rocky start and incremental change from a lackluster experience to a fully-fledged, immersive, open world. Farming is an essential part of the game and one of its best parts. In No Man's Sky , players can explore the universe using equipment such as the Haz-Mat Gauntlets to farm fictional exotic crops for crafting items and products that can be sold to merchants.

Examples include solar vine and frost wort, which players can farm in their base or outside depending on the planet's environment. The depth of 'space farming' in No Man's Sky is extensive, making it the best fictional farming open-world game.

4 Terraria

Endless Creativity, Deep Farming Mechanics

Terraria is an open-world game that blends mythical and nonfictional elements to create a nostalgic and expansive farming experience. In Terraria, players can practically do whatever they want, whether digging for treasure, fighting monsters, or opening up a peaceful farm - the choice is yours. The game features generated worlds and great farming mechanics, with the ability to plant a vast range of herbs such as daybloom and deathweed, trees, mushrooms, pumpkins, and more. Terraria is a great open-world game with some of the most in-depth farming mechanics in gaming.

3 Stardew Valley

Nostalgic Graphics, Deep Farming Simulation

An open-world game known for its appealing 64-bit graphical style, Stardew Valley has comprehensive farming mechanics that allow players to create the farm of their dreams. Stardew Valley blends classical farming mechanics with fictional elements, such as raising livestock and harvesting crops. These fictional components include fighting witches and other monsters.

While Stardew Valley is not the most extensive farming open-world experience on this list - lacking the graphical immersion of its counterparts, its farming mechanics have considerable depth, with elements such as fishing adding to the quality of farming simulation available. The deep, rewarding gameplay and fictional and nostalgic graphics make Stardew Valley one of the best open-world games with farming mechanics.

2 Farming Simulator 22

Realistic Farming, Ultimate Simulation Experience

This list would only be complete by mentioning a Farming Simulator game. First released in 2008 on the PC, Farming Simulator has gone from strength to strength, satisfying hardcore farming fans who want to experience all the nuts and bolts of owning your own farm. The most recent title in the series, Farming Simulator 22 , is its best entry - with hundreds of machines for players to use, new crops to plant, and even a multiplayer option for a collaborative farming experience. The game also lets players experience three different biomes from Europe to America.

Released on the latest consoles, such as the PlayStation 5, the game is also the most visually and technically impressive game in the series, immersing players fully in the technicalities of being a farmer. Farming Simulator 22 is currently the best technical open-world farming simulator.

1 Minecraft

Genre-Defining Sandbox, Innovative Farming Mechanics

Arguably the most influential game on this list, Minecraft set the standard for basic farming in expansive gaming environments. Released in 2011, Minecraft enabled players to build farms on a considerable scale, inspiring a new genre of titles such as Stardew Valley . Like Stardew Valley, Minecraft also played the nostalgia card with pixelated 16-bit graphics - harkening back to the fourth generation of video game consoles such as the Super NES.

Over a decade later, Minecraft and its farming mechanics are still going strong, with continuous updates adding new farming elements, such as the ability to farm bees. Due to the open sandbox mechanics of Minecraft , players have also created intricate in-game systems and methods to farm creatively and efficiently, adding further depth to gameplay. Minecraft is the best open-world farming game, influencing most of the other titles on this list.

item.title: Diablo 4 Players Discover Broken Spiritborn Build
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Diablo 4 has introduced the Spiritborn class, offering versatility with four Spirit Guardians.
  • A broken Spiritborn build utilizing Sepazontec has emerged for massive damage.
  • This Spiritborn Evade build stands out as a low-effort, high-reward option, but may be nerfed soon.

Diablo 4 players have discovered a new broken build, and it turns the Spiritborn into a killing machine. After much anticipation, Diablo 4 has finally received its first expansion, Vessel of Hatred, which introduces a variety of exciting content such as new areas and dungeons to explore, enemies, and the sixth playable class in Blizzard's action RPG.

This class is the Spiritborn, an ancient warrior from the depths of the Nahantu jungle, and is exclusive to the Diablo 4 expansion. With it, players can create an aggressive character who deals great damage and moves efficiently, crossing distances quickly. The Spiritborn's greatest appeal, however, is the possibility of choosing one of four Spirit Guardians, the centipede, eagle, gorilla, and jaguar, adding a layer of versatility to the class due to the unique benefits each spirit provides.

Diablo 4 players have discovered a new broken build for the Spiritborn that relies on the Sepazontec, one of the class's Unique items, and the Spirit Guardian mechanic. As demonstrated by Reddit user zirax1000, the character deals massive damage simply by using Evade. The reason lies in Sepazontec, whose Unique Afix makes the third cast of a basic skill hit three times. Since Thunderspike can reset the cooldown of Evasion with every third hit, there is the option to evade infinitely. Then, players must choose the eagle as their Spirit Guardian, making the Spiritborn deal impressive damage by simply spamming Evade, killing enemies without breaking a sweat.

Spiritborn Evade Isn't Diablo 4's First Broken Build

While Spiritborn Evade is one of the first broken builds of the new class that works well for farming and has enough strength for pits, this isn't the first case. There's no shortage of examples of popular overpowered Diablo 4 builds, such as Whirlwind Barbarian, also known as “spin to win,” or Lightning Spear, which turns Sorcerer mains into Thor. The comments on the OP's video showed surprise at the build, and how effective it is.

While previous builds have achieved broken status at the cost of grinding Mythic Unique items and endgame content, Spiritborn Evade stands out for being a build that can be done without too much effort, while the result is impressive. As such, Diablo 4 players who own the Vessel of Hatred expansion who wish to try Spiritborn Evade should act fast because once the devs learn how effective the build is, the chances are that it will be nerfed in one of the game's updates, something the community has seen happen on previous occasions.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake: How To Open The Gemstone Box In Lakeview Hotel
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find All Gemstones In Silent Hill 2 Remake
  • Opening Gemstone Box And The Safe In The Break Room

When James arrives at the Employee Elevator in Lakeview Hotel , he will find the elevator not moving unless he places all his weapons and equipment in the Cabinet nearby. The elevator takes the players to the Employee Section of the Hotel, where they will encounter the monster that moves around using its arms stuck to the roof. Stealth is the best option, as there is no means to harm them.

Players will find a Gemstone Box that they might find hard to open. This guide includes the details on the location of all the Gemstones and where to go after in Silent Hill 2 Remake .

This puzzle was attempted on the Standard Puzzle Challenge Difficulty .

Where To Find All Gemstones In Silent Hill 2 Remake

To find the three Gemstone follow these steps:

  1. Enter the Cafeteria by jumping through the window and head to the Kitchen to find the Green Gemstone .
  2. Head inside the Pantry and go through the open door to reach the Freezer Room . Pick up the Blue Gemstone from the fridge. There is a Glimpses of the Past inside the Pantry that you can also pick up.
  3. Go to the Manager's Office and turn right to find a cupboard you can push in the TV Room. Inside the Manager's Room, you will find the Red Gemstone .

Opening Gemstone Box And The Safe In The Break Room

Once you have all the Gemstones, go to the Gemstone Box inside the Manager's Office. To open the Gemstone Box, you must:

  • Place the Red Gemstone in the top right slot.
  • Place the Green Gemstone in the top left slot.
  • Place the Blue Gemstone in the bottom left slot.

This will give you the Keypad Numbers Memo , which shows the number " 7414 ". Go to the Break Room, use this code on the Safe to open it, and find the Video Tape and Basement Key inside. Open the Basement Door and proceed downstairs to progress in the story.

item.title: World of Warcraft Explains How the 20th Anniversary Event Will Work
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • World of Warcraft celebrates its 20th anniversary with a huge event from October 22 to January 7, including a new raid and Tier 2 armor sets.
  • Players can earn Bronze Celebration Tokens, Timewarped Badges, and Relic Coffer Keys to trade for various rewards and gear.
  • Vendors at the festival grounds offer different items in exchange for event currencies, ensuring players can acquire a variety of items.

World of Warcraft has detailed all the activities, currencies, and rewards that will be available during its 20th anniversary event. Armed with this knowledge, World of Warcraft fans can jump into the event starting October 22 to ensure they get as much out of the celebration as possible.

November 23, 2024 marks the 20th anniversary of World of Warcraft . To celebrate the major milestone, World of Warcraft is dropping a huge content update, along with an in-game event from October 22 until January 7 that includes tons of in-game activities and rewards, such as the new Blackrock Depths raid and upscaled Tier 2 armor sets.

Now, World of Warcraft has revealed the minutiae of the upcoming event to better prepare fans for the festivities. In the World of Warcraft anniversary blog post, Blizzard talked about Bronze Celebration Tokens, Timewarped Badges, and myriad other currencies used in the event, as well as where they are obtained and what exactly they can purchase. Though there are hundreds of items to collect during the event, World of Warcraft believes those who play regularly should be able to pick up most, if not all, of the new items from the event – especially with the help of achievements and unlocks that provide currency boosts and discounts.

World of Warcraft 20th Anniversary Event Details

  • Currencies
    • Bronze Celebration Tokens
      • Used for: Anniversary items and Tier 2 transmog sets.
      • Earned from:
        • Event quests
        • Chromie’s Codex
        • Guest Relations secrets event
        • Blackrock Depths
        • World bosses (both from the event and in Khaz Algar)
        • The War Within weekly quests and world activities
        • Classic Timewalking
        • Killing Queen Ansurek in Nerub-ar Palace
        • Weekly PvP Warmode, Conquest, Honor, and Brawl activities

    • Timewarped Badges
      • Used for: Timewalking items, legacy PvP gear, anniversary items
      • Earned from: Timewalking event quests and instances.

    • Timewarped Relic Coffer Keys
      • Used for: Buying Blackrock Depths raid gear
      • Earned from: Blackrock Depths raid (all difficulties)

  • Achievements and Unlocks
    • Earn 100 Bronze Celebration Tokens to unlock extra activities to get Bronze Celebration Tokens
    • Upgraded Apparel: Buy one Tier 2 transmog set to reduce the cost of future ones from 60 to 40 tokens
    • Classy Dresser: Buy a second Tier 2 set to reduce the cost to 20
    • A Cool Twenty Years: Meta-achievement that awards the Coldflame Tempest mount
      • I Have That One!: Match 1 mount during Mount Mania.
      • Fashion Critic: Cast 1 vote at the Fashion Frenzy.
      • Pet Mischief: Use a pet disguiser to look like your pet and explore the area.
      • Balloonist: Ride one of the celebration balloons.
      • Peanut Gallery: React to Lorewalker Cho’s stories.
      • An Original: Defeat at least one of the following world bosses during the WoW Anniversary: Azuregos, Lord Kazzak, Lethon, Emeriss, Taerar, Ysondre.
      • A Gatecrasher: Defeat at least one of the following world bosses during the WoW Anniversary: Doomwalker, Sha of Anger, Archavon the Stonewatcher
      • Codex Editor: Ahn’Qiraj: Complete the scenario, “The Codex of Chromie.”

Tons of vendors can be found on the festival grounds for World of Warcraft ’s 20th anniversary, many of whom offer special items in exchange for event currencies. Players can trade Bronze Celebration Tokens with Traeya for the updated World of Warcraft Tier 2 armor sets, Historian Ma’di for the new anniversary rewards, and Storekeeper Reginald for items from previous anniversaries. Timewarped Badges can be traded with Bobadormu for Classic Timewalking items, Jorek Ironside and Thanthaldis Snowgleam for PvP weapons and armor, or Historian Ma’di for some returning anniversary favorites. Lastly, three Dark Iron Dwarf vendors offer gear from the three difficulties of Blackrock Depths for Timewarped Relic Coffer Keys, which drop from the raid.

World of Warcraft 20th Anniversary Event Vendors

Vendor

Items Sold

Currencies Needed

Traeya

Tier 2 transmog ensembles

Bronze Celebration Tokens

Storekeeper Reginald

Anniversary rewards from previous years

Bronze Celebration Tokens, Gold

Historian Ma'di

New and returning anniversary items

Bronze Celebration Tokens, Timewarped Badges

Bobadormu

Classic Timewalking pets, toys, mounts, gear, cosmetics, and reputation

Timewarped Badges

Time-Displaced Thanthaldis Snowgleam and Jorek Ironside

Legacy PvP weapons and armor

Timewarped Badges, Marks of Honor

Braggi Brazenbrass, Kraegan Emberforge, Hilda Hellforge

Raid Finder, Normal, and Heroic Blackrock Depths gear

Relic Coffer Keys

Luckily, World of Warcraft fans who can’t collect all the items this year won’t be entirely out of luck. The blog confirmed that at the very least, the new Tier 2 World of Warcraft class sets will return in later years, so players will have the chance to pick up those they missed during future anniversary events.

The Trading Post is also getting in on the fun starting in November. The free reward for completing the Traveler’s Log is a cycle of back items inspired by the factions of Warcraft 3 , and the World of Warcraft class ensembles from last year are returning with their class restrictions removed, so fans should be sure to save some Trader’s Tender if they can.
